entries.meaning: (mechanical engineering, automotive, rail transport) A brake in a vehicle, set by hand, and usually locking on until released by hand, enabling its use when parked.

(mechanical engineering, automotive, rail transport) The mechanism, particularly the locking hand-operated lever or foot-operated toggle lever in a motorcar or the hand-operated crank on a railcar, which is used to set and release such a brake.

verbs.description: handbrake (third-person singular simple present handbrakes, present participle handbraking, simple past and past participle handbraked)

entries.meaning: To apply the handbrake in a vehicle.
